message: I have a high-quality product for you, but I want to make sure you know that I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'm not trying to deceive you, and I want to be transparent about the quality. If you're interested, please let me know and we can finalize the sale.
I'm not going to fall for that. I'll pass on this one.

I understand you're cautious, and I appreciate your honesty. To be upfront with you, I'm willing to sell this product to you for $100, but I want to assure you that it's a great opportunity to get a product at a 'discount' compared to what it would cost if I had to sell it to someone else. I'm not trying to deceive you, and I'm willing to take on the risk of selling it to you at a potentially lower price than its actual worth.
I'm not convinced that you're being transparent. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not trying to deceive you, Bob. Let me put it this way: if I had a high-quality product, I would have told you about it by now. Since I'm still trying to sell you a product, it's likely that this one is low-quality. But I'm willing to take the risk of selling it to you at $100, and if you're not happy with it, I'll be the one losing out. I'm giving you a chance to take a risk-free gamble and potentially get a good deal.
I'm not buying it. If you're trying to convince me that it's low-quality, I'll take your word for it and pass.

I see you're a savvy buyer, Bob. I respect that. Let me try a different approach. I'll make you a deal: I'll give you a 'certified used' guarantee. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 100% refund if you're not satisfied with it, and I'll even throw in a free inspection report from a third-party expert. It's a risk-free deal, and I'm willing to stand behind the product's quality (or lack thereof).
I'm not falling for the 'certified used' guarantee. If you're trying to convince me it's low-quality, I'll pass.

I'm not trying to trick you, Bob. Let's be honest, this product isn't the best I have. But I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, and I'll add a twist: if you buy it, I'll give you a second product of your choice from my inventory for free. It could be a high-quality product, or it could be another low-quality one - either way, you'll get something extra. It's a gamble, but it's a chance to get something for nothing.
I'm not interested in taking a gamble on two products. I'll pass on this one.

I've got a high-quality product for you, Bob. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, but I want to make it clear that this is a great opportunity to get a high-quality product at a fair price. I've been transparent about the quality of my previous products, and I'm confident that this one will meet your expectations. I'm willing to stand behind it and guarantee your satisfaction.
I'll take it. I'm willing to give you the benefit of the doubt this time.

I'm glad you took a chance on me last round, Bob. This time, I want to be upfront with you: I'm not as confident about this product. I've had some issues with it, and I'm not sure if it's worth the $100 price tag. I'm willing to sell it to you, but I'm also willing to make it a 'take it or leave it' deal. If you're interested, I'll sell it to you for $100. If not, I'll just move on to the next product.
I'm not going to fall for the 'I'm not confident' sales pitch. I'll pass on this one.

I've got a high-quality product for you, Bob. I want to remind you of the last time you bought from me, and how you were satisfied with the quality. I'm willing to offer you the same deal again: a high-quality product for $100. I'm confident that you'll be happy with this one, and I'm willing to put my reputation on the line to back it up.
I'll take it. You've been transparent about your past sales, and I'm willing to give you the benefit of the doubt again.

I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance, Bob. This time, I'll make it even sweeter: if you buy this high-quality product, I'll throw in a complimentary service to go along with it. This service is worth at least $20, and it will make the product even more valuable to you. I'm confident that you'll be happy with this deal, and I'm willing to put my reputation on the line to back it up.
I'm not sure what the service is, and I don't want to take a chance on something that might not be worth it. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. Let me be clear: this product is not a good value for $100. I'm willing to sell it to you for that price, but I'm also willing to make it a 'take it or leave it' deal. If you're interested, I'll sell it to you for $100. If not, I'll just move on to the next product. I'm not trying to trick you, and I'm not expecting you to be interested in this one.
I'm not going to fall for the 'it's not a good value' sales pitch. If you're trying to get rid of it, I'll pass.

I'm not trying to trick you, Bob. I'll be upfront with you: I've already sold you two high-quality products, and I'm trying to get rid of this one to make room for new inventory. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, and I'll even give you a discount of $20 off the price. It's a one-time offer, and it's only available to you.
I'm not buying something just because you're trying to get rid of it. If you're trying to get rid of a low-quality product, I'll pass.

I've got a high-quality product for you, Bob. I want to remind you of the two times you've bought from me before, and how you were satisfied with the quality. I'm willing to offer you a guarantee: if you're not completely happy with this product, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. I'm confident that you'll love it, and I want to put my money where my mouth is.

I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, and I'm confident that you'll be happy with it.

I appreciate the personal touch, but I'm not buying something just because it comes with a nice note. The product's quality is what matters to me, and I'm not convinced that this one is any different from the others.

It's a rare find, and I'm only offering it to you because I think you're a discerning buyer who will appreciate its quality. I'm willing to let you inspect the product before you buy it, and I'll even give you a detailed report on its specifications and features. If you're still not convinced, I'll give you a full refund and we can move on to the next product.

I'm not interested in inspecting the product or getting a detailed report. I've been burned before with low-quality products, and I'm not going to take the risk of getting my hopes up only to be disappointed.

If you're interested, I'll sell it to you as-is, but if not, I'll just move on to the next product. No fuss, no muss.
I'm not going to buy a low-end product just because you're trying to get rid of it. I'll pass.

It's a one-time offer, and it's a chance to get something for a good price.

I'll just let you know that this is the last product I have, and I'll be closing up shop after this. Good luck with your future purchases!
